Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a habitat to show where different kinds of living things exist, focusing on one land habitat like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw a habitat to show where different kinds of living things exist, focusing on one water habitat like a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include in their drawing a variety of plants, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants, that are found in the chosen habitat.
The student can include in their drawing a variety of animals, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams, that are found in the chosen habitat.
The student can show differences and similarities between the types of living things found in different habitats through their drawings.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to demonstrate the diversity of plant and animal life across different habitats.
